q: Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said. But Keith Urbahn, who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out. "This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Urbahn said

Rivalries between State and Defense are nothing new, yet Ms. Condoleezza Rice 's most "notable feature" of management, writes Mr. Donald Rumsfeld , was her commitment, whenever possible, to "bridging" differences between the agencies, rather than bringing those differences to the President Bush for decisions.
